tool.name: basinDelin

param.name: stabbr
param.dialogReference:
The abbreviated name of the region on which to perform delineation.

This must be an abbreviation of one of the 50 United States (ex. NY, TX), the District of Columbia (DC), the Connecticut River Basin (CRB), the Delaware River Basin (DRB) or the Rainy River Basin (RRB).

param.name: schema_file
param.displayname: Regional schema FGDB or PRJ file
param.dialogReference: The input schema, in either a .gdb or .prj file.

param.name: pourpoint
param.dialogReference:
The json representation of the pourpoint to be used for delineation.

Example '[-123.456789, 44.444444]'

param.name: pourpointwkid
param.dialogReference: The Esri Well Known ID (wkid) of the pourpoint.

param.name: basin_params
param.dialogReference: If checked, basin characteristics will be calculated for the output basin.

param.name: parameters_list
param.dialogReference:
The semi-colon (;) separated list of characteristics to be computed. Required if calculating basin characteristics.

Ex. "drnarea;precip"

tool.summary:
The Basin Delineation tool processes a watershed based on the specified pour point and returns the associated watershed to the output basin file.

Basin characteristics can also be calculated for the output basin.

If you have already delineated the basin, use the "Calculate Basin Characteristics" tool, and select the delineated basin as the input basin.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The Basin Delineation tool processes a watershed based on the specified pour point and returns the associated watershed to the output basin file.

Basin characteristics can also be calculated for the output basin.

If you have already delineated the basin, use the "Calculate Basin Characteristics" tool, and select the delineated basin as the input basin.
